Parameter.docString: Determines the type of linear solver that will be used. The parameters for each solver type are specified in the sublist "Linear Solver Types"
Parameter.name: Linear Solver Type

Parameter.docString: Type of linear solver algorithm to use.
Parameter.name: Solver Type

Parameter.docString: Number of linear solver iterations to skip between applying user-defined convergence test.
Parameter.name: Convergence Test Frequency

Parameter.docString: The relative residual tolerance that needs to be achieved by the iterative solver in order for the linear system to be declared converged.
Parameter.name: Convergence Tolerance

Parameter.docString: The maximum number of restarts allowed for each set of RHS solved.
Parameter.name: Maximum Restarts

Parameter.docString: The maximum number of block iterations allowed for each set of RHS solved.
Parameter.name: Maximum Iterations

Parameter.docString: The maximum number of blocks allowed in the Krylov subspace for each set of RHS solved.
Parameter.name: Num Blocks

Parameter.docString: The number of vectors in each block. This number times the number of blocks is the total Krylov subspace dimension.
Parameter.name: Block Size

Parameter.docString: Whether the solver manager should adapt the block size based on the number of RHS to solve.
Parameter.name: Adaptive Block Size

Parameter.docString: What type(s) of solver information should be outputted to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Verbosity

Parameter.docString: What style is used for the solver information outputted to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Output Style

Parameter.docString: How often convergence information should be outputted to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Output Frequency

Parameter.docString: A reference-counted pointer to the output stream where all solver output is sent.
Parameter.name: Output Stream

Parameter.docString: When convergence information is printed, only show the maximum relative residual norm when the block size is greater than one.
Parameter.name: Show Maximum Residual Norm Only

Parameter.docString: Whether the solver manager should use the flexible variant of GMRES.
Parameter.name: Flexible Gmres

Parameter.docString: Whether the explicitly computed residual should be used in the convergence test.
Parameter.name: Explicit Residual Test

Parameter.docString: The type of scaling used in the implicit residual convergence test.
Parameter.name: Implicit Residual Scaling

Parameter.docString: The type of scaling used in the explicit residual convergence test.
Parameter.name: Explicit Residual Scaling

Parameter.docString: The string to use as a prefix for the timer labels.
Parameter.name: Timer Label

Parameter.docString: The type of orthogonalization to use: DGKS, ICGS, or IMGS.
Parameter.name: Orthogonalization

Parameter.docString: The constant used by DGKS orthogonalization to determine whether another step of classical Gram-Schmidt is necessary.
Parameter.name: Orthogonalization Constant

Parameter.name: Timer Label

Parameter.docString: The type of orthogonalization to use. Valid options: "DGKS", "ICGS", "IMGS", "TSQR", or "Simple"
Parameter.name: Orthogonalization

Parameter.docString: Maximum number of orthogonalization passes (includes the first). Default is 2, since "twice is enough" for Krylov methods.
Parameter.name: maxNumOrthogPasses

Parameter.docString: Block reorthogonalization threshhold.
Parameter.name: blkTol

Parameter.docString: (Non-block) reorthogonalization threshold.
Parameter.name: depTol

Parameter.docString: Singular block detection threshold.
Parameter.name: singTol

Parameter.docString: When using DGKS orthogonalization: the "depTol" constant, used to determine whether another step of classical Gram-Schmidt is necessary. Otherwise ignored.
Parameter.name: Orthogonalization Constant

Parameter.docString: The relative residual tolerance that needs to be achieved by the iterative solver in order for the linear system to be declared converged.
Parameter.name: Convergence Tolerance

Parameter.docString: The maximum number of block iterations allowed for each set of RHS solved.
Parameter.name: Maximum Iterations

Parameter.docString: Block Size Parameter -- currently must be 1 for RCG
Parameter.name: Block Size

Parameter.docString: The length of a cycle (and this max number of search vectors kept)
Parameter.name: Num Blocks

Parameter.docString: The number of vectors in the recycle subspace.
Parameter.name: Num Recycled Blocks

Parameter.docString: What type(s) of solver information should be outputted to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Verbosity

Parameter.docString: What style is used for the solver information outputted to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Output Style

Parameter.docString: How often convergence information should be outputted to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Output Frequency

Parameter.docString: A reference-counted pointer to the output stream where all solver output is sent.
Parameter.name: Output Stream

Parameter.docString: When convergence information is printed, only show the maximum relative residual norm when the block size is greater than one.
Parameter.name: Show Maximum Residual Norm Only

Parameter.docString: The string to use as a prefix for the timer labels.
Parameter.name: Timer Label

Parameter.docString: Relative residual tolerance that needs to be achieved by the iterative solver, in order for the linear system to be declared converged.
Parameter.name: Convergence Tolerance

Parameter.docString: Maximum number of iterations allowed for each right-hand side solved.
Parameter.name: Maximum Iterations

Parameter.docString: Number of vectors in each block. WARNING: The current implementation of MINRES only accepts a block size of 1, since it can only solve for 1 right-hand side at a time.
Parameter.name: Block Size

Parameter.docString: The type(s) of solver information that should be written to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Verbosity

Parameter.docString: What style is used for the solver information written to the output stream.
Parameter.name: Output Style

Parameter.docString: How often (in terms of number of iterations) intermediate convergence information should be written to the output stream. -1 means never.
Parameter.name: Output Frequency

Parameter.docString: A reference-counted pointer to the output stream where all solver output is sent. The output stream defaults to stdout.
Parameter.name: Output Stream

Parameter.docString: The string to use as a prefix for the timer labels.
Parameter.name: Timer Label

Parameter.docString: The verbosity level to use to override whatever is set in code. The value of "default" will allow the level set in code to be used.
Parameter.name: Verbosity Level

Parameter.docString: The file to send output to. If the value "none" is used, then whatever is set in code will be used. However, any other std::string value will be used to create an std::ofstream object to a file with the given name. Therefore, any valid file name is a valid std::string value for this parameter.
Parameter.name: Output File

Parameter.docString: Determines the type of preconditioner that will be used. This option is only meaningful for linear solvers that accept preconditioner factory objects! The parameters for each preconditioner are specified in the sublist "Preconditioner Types"
Parameter.name: Preconditioner Type

Parameter.docString: Select the default method type which also sets parameter defaults in the sublist "ML Settings"!
Parameter.name: Base Method Defaults

Parameter.docString: Enables/disables the reuse of the fine level smoother.
Parameter.name: Reuse Fine Level Smoother

Parameter.docString: Type of Ifpack preconditioner to use.
Parameter.name: Prec Type

Parameter.docString: Number of rows/columns overlapped between subdomains in different processes in the additive Schwarz-type domain-decomposition preconditioners.
Parameter.name: Overlap

Parameter.docString: The verbosity level to use to override whatever is set in code. The value of "default" will allow the level set in code to be used.
Parameter.name: Verbosity Level

Parameter.docString: The file to send output to. If the value "none" is used, then whatever is set in code will be used. However, any other std::string value will be used to create an std::ofstream object to a file with the given name. Therefore, any valid file name is a valid std::string value for this parameter.
Parameter.name: Output File

Parameter.docString: When this option is set to true, the linear solver factory will be wrapped in a delayed evaluation Decorator factory object. This results in a delay in the creation of a linear solver (and the associated preconditioner) until the first solve is actually performed. This helps in cases where it is not known a-priori if a linear solve will be needed on a given linear operator and therefore can significantly improve performance for some types of algorithms such as NOX and LOCA.
Parameter.name: Enable Delayed Solver Construction

String.stringDoc: Block GMRES solver for nonsymmetric linear systems. It can also solve single right-hand side systems, and can also perform Flexible GMRES (where the preconditioner may change at every iteration, for example for inner-outer iterations), by setting options in the "Block GMRES" sublist.

GMRES solver for nonsymmetric linear systems, that performs single right-hand side solves on multiple right-hand sides at once. It exploits operator multivector multiplication in order to amortize global communication costs. Individual linear systems are deflated out as they are solved.
Block CG solver for symmetric (Hermitian in complex arithmetic) positive definite linear systems. It can also solve single right-hand-side systems.

CG solver that performs single right-hand side CG on multiple right-hand sides at once. It exploits operator multivector multiplication in order to amortize global communication costs. Individual linear systems are deflated out as they are solved.
GMRES solver for nonsymmetric linear systems, that performs subspace recycling to accelerate convergence for sequences of related linear systems.
CG solver for symmetric (Hermitian in complex arithmetic) positive definite linear systems, that performs subspace recycling to accelerate convergence for sequences of related linear systems.
MINRES solver for symmetric indefinite linear systems. It performs single-right-hand-side solves on multiple right-hand sides sequentially.
Do not set any default parameters
Set default parameters for a smoothed aggregation method
Set default parameters for a domain decomposition method
Set default parameters for a domain decomposition method special to ML
Set default parameters for a Maxwell-type of linear operator
Produce a higher level of output
Produce the highest level of output
